intro: Dypsidium catatianum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the stem's apex. Dypsidium catatianum is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
